snippet: Two of the biggest makers of electric cars are pushing plans to lift sales: General Motors, aiming for the luxury market with the Cadillac ELR, and Nissan, with a cheaper Leaf.
abstract: General Motors and Nissan, two of the biggest makers of electric cars, are eager to bring more models to showrooms despite sluggish sales and little interest from buyers; GM aims for the luxury market with the Cadillac ELR, and Nissan introduces a cheaper Leaf vehicle, proving both companies are in the electric-car business for the long haul.

byline.contributor: Vindu Goel contributed reporting from Detroit.

lead_paragraph: Two of the biggest makers of electric cars are pushing plans to lift sales: General Motors, aiming for the luxury market with the Cadillac ELR, and Nissan, with a cheaper Leaf.

headline.seo: Cadillac ELR and Cheaper Nissan Leaf Extend Push Into Electric Cars
headline.main: 2 Makers Press the Case for Electric Cars
headline.print_headline: 2 Makers Press the Case for Electric Cars
